author: Julia Shapero
description: The House Select Committee on China is calling for stronger restrictions on companies producing the equipment used to make semidconductor chips amid concerns their sales are boosting Beijing’s chipmaking capabilities.  In a new report Tuesday, the panel said Chinese firms spent $38 billion on semiconductor manufacturing equipment from five major companies based in the U.S.…
title: House China panel calls for stronger restrictions on chip ‘toolmakers’

description: Pope Leo XIV told U.S. bishops to openly state their concerns regarding the Trump administration’s immigration policies on Wednesday, according to Reuters. During his meeting at the Vatican with the bishops and social workers from the border between the U.S. and Mexico, the pope received letters from migrants regarding their concerns around President Trump’s mass…
title: Bishops need to address Trump immigration crackdown: Pope Leo

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said Wednesday that peace negotiations with Ukraine have been stalled since the August Alaska summit, where President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin made commitments to cooling the conflict in Eastern Europe.  “We have to acknowledge that the strong momentum created in Anchorage toward reaching agreements has been largely…
title: Russia: ‘Momentum’ toward peace from Alaska talks is now ‘exhausted’

author: Julia Manchester
description: Virginia Sen. Tim Kaine (D) called Democratic state attorney general nominee Jay Jones’ recently unearthed violent text messages about former state House Speaker Todd Gilbert (R) “indefensible,” but said he still ultimately supports the Democrat.  “Jay has apologized. The statements that he made were indefensible but I’ve known Jay Jones for 25 years and I…
title: Kaine says Jones comments ‘indefensible,’ but he is ‘still a supporter’

author: Max Rego
description: Homeland Security Security Kristi Noem called a song Zach Bryan teased last week “disrespectful” to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers. “I hope he understands how completely disrespectful that song is, not just to law enforcement but to this country, to every single individual that has ever stood up and fought for our freedoms. He…
title: Noem slams Zach Bryan ICE lyrics: ‘Completely disrespectful’

author: Kevin B. Kimble, opinion contributor
description: Index funds have long been a cornerstone of democratized investing in America. But instead of strengthening this critical lifeline for working Americans, this GOP lawsuit is the prime example of Republicans’ misguided economic policies.
title: Republicans are again crushing the working class with their energy policy

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The IRS shared guidance Wednesday suggesting furloughed employees are guaranteed back pay under a 2019 law despite White House objections.  “Although you will be placed in non-pay and non-duty status during the furlough, the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019 requires employees of the federal government who are furloughed or required to work during…
title: New IRS furlough notices include back pay guarantee despite OMB guidance

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Ten House Democrats are pressing Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) to bring the chamber back by next week to pass a bill to pay service members before funding runs out due to the ongoing government shutdown, though the Louisiana Republican said that won’t be happening. In a Wednesday letter led by Democratic Reps. Gabe Vasquez (N.M.) and Derek…
title: Democrats call on Johnson to bring back House to pay troops

author: Julia Manchester
description: Former Rep. Katie Porter’s (D-Calif.) Democratic rivals in California’s gubernatorial race slammed her response to a question about what she would say to the state’s voters who voted for President Trump in last year’s election.  In an interview with CBS News that has gained massive attention, Porter was asked what she would say to the 40 percent…
title: Democratic rivals hit Katie Porter response to Trump question

author: Ella Lee
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va. — Former FBI Director James Comey has pleaded not guilty to charges linked to his 2020 congressional testimony about the bureau’s investigation into Russian ties to President Trump’s 2016 campaign. A trial has been set for Jan. 5. It is expected to last two to three days. “My client is anxious to get to a…
title: James Comey pleads not guilty to charges stemming from 2020 testimony

author: Max Burns, opinion contributor
description: For Earle-Sears and the Virginia GOP, the economy isn’t the problem — the scandal-plagued Republicans who wrecked the economy are.
title: In the Trump economy, social issues can’t save the Virginia GOP

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Sen. Chris Coons (D-Del.) reflected on Attorney General Pam Bondi’s fiery Tuesday hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee, describing it as more “like a boxing ring” than a formal inquiry.  Coons said Bondi was “aggressive” and “combative,” specifically with Democratic senators, and displayed a pattern of attacks against lawmakers. “A key part of what the…
title: Senate Democrat: Bondi hearing ‘felt more like a boxing ring’

author: Ella Lee
description: U.S. District Judge Michael Nachmanoff is overseeing the criminal case of James Comey, the former FBI director and a longtime adversary of President Trump.   Nachmanoff, who was appointed by former President Biden, was confirmed in 2021, the newest addition to the Alexandria, Va.-based federal court where Comey was hit with two federal charges following…
title: Who is Michael Nachmanoff, the judge overseeing James Comey’s case

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Tennessee state Rep. Justin Pearson (D) — one of two Democrats to face expulsion in 2023 over gun control protests held in the state House — announced on Wednesday that he’s challenging Rep. Steve Cohen (D-Tenn.) for his Memphis-based seat in the House next year, adding to a growing list of younger candidates challenging established incumbents.…
title: Tennessee lawmaker Justin Pearson challenges Cohen for Memphis-based House seat

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Florida state Rep. Kevin Steele (R) filed a bill Tuesday that threatens state funding to public universities and colleges if they do not rename specific roads after conservative activist Charlie Kirk.   The bill points to specific roads at campuses Steele wants colleges to rename after Kirk, who was assassinated last month while speaking on a…
title: Florida Republican unveils bill threatening state funding if colleges don’t rename roads after Charlie Kirk

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) suggested that President Trump is deploying federal troops in Chicago because he is “suffering dementia.” In an interview Tuesday with the Chicago Tribune, the outspoken Trump critic and possible 2028 presidential candidate contended that Trump’s fixation on the Windy City comes from “something in the recesses of his brain.” “This…
title: Pritzker on Trump deploying troops to Chicago: ‘This is a man who’s suffering dementia’

author: Colin Pascal, opinion contributor
description: Counterintelligence can be a powerful force for the national good when its practitioners employ the full range of its capabilities.
title: The SECURE Act empowers US counterintelligence to go on offense

author: Judy Kurtz
description: Jeff Bridges is channeling The Dude, his famed character from “The Big Lebowski,” to speak out against U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). “Let’s get ICE off the streets and into our beverages, man,” Bridges said as The Dude during an appearance Tuesday on ABC’s “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” “This aggression will not stand!” Bridges said, in a…
title: Jeff Bridges channels The Dude to slam ICE: Get ‘off the streets and into our beverages, man’

author: Max Rego
description: National Guard soldiers arrived near Chicago on Monday amid President Trump’s federal crackdown on crime, and Memphis could see troops by Friday, according to local authorities. The troops in Illinois are stationed at an Army Reserve center in Elwood, roughly 55 miles southwest of Chicago. The Associated Press reported Wednesday morning that supplies were dropped…
title: National Guard troops positioned near Chicago; Memphis could be next

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and GOP congressional leaders will give remarks Wednesday morning as the government shutdown starts its second week. The Senate is expected to once again take votes on dueling stopgap funding bills. Republicans have pressed their Democratic colleagues to pass the GOP-led “clean” continuing resolution that would fund the government at…
title: Watch live: House Republicans give remarks on Day 8 of shutdown

author: Sheldon H. Jacobson, opinion contributor
description: Like every government shutdown, this one will end, with both parties claiming victory. Yet there is no victory when Congress cannot do its job and fund the government.
title: How to prevent the next government shutdown: Ban continuing resolutions.

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Wednesday called for Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) and Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson (D) to be jailed as the two leaders push back on the Trump administration’s crime crackdown and immigration enforcement raids on the Windy City. “Chicago Mayor should be in jail for failing to protect [Immigration and Customs Enforcement] Officers!”…
title: Trump says Pritzker, Chicago mayor ‘should be in jail’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche said former FBI Director James Comey will not be paraded in front of news media for a so-called perp walk when he is arraigned Wednesday morning. In a sit-down interview with Fox News Digital, the No. 2 Justice Department official denied reporting from MSNBC and other news outlets about a…
title: No perp walk for Comey, Blanche says

author: Julia Manchester
description: California gubernatorial candidate and former Rep. Katie Porter (D-Calif.) tried to end an interview with a reporter after she was asked what she would say to voters in the state who voted for President Trump.  “What do you say to the 40 percent of California voters, who you’ll need in order to win, who voted…
title: California governor candidate Katie Porter cuts off interview after testy Trump exchange

author: Alexander Motyl , opinion contributor
description: Today's Russia is especially tired and weak — savage only inasmuch as it attempts to pretend it is still vigorous and strong.
title: If Russia is a paper bear, it is because Putin made it that way

author: Jianli Yang, opinion contributor
description: Just days after Vladimir Putin stood beside Xi Jinping at Beijing’s grand military parade following the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit, Russia’s two largest state-owned enterprises, Rosatom and Gazprom, announced they were preparing to issue yuan-denominated “panda” bonds in China. The timing was no accident. Moscow is sending a message that it has found an alternative financial anchor in Beijing,…
title: Nukes and bonds: How Putin and Xi are building a new nexus against the West

author: Artem Kolisnichenko, opinion contributor
description: The main problem is clear: overcrowding.
title: More immigration detentions, more deaths in custody from overcrowding

author: The Associated Press
description: The camera display malfunction is caused by a software problem.
title: Toyota recalls nearly 400,000 Tundras and Sequoias over malfunctioning rearview camera
